BB10-WebWorks-Samples.note: Samples rely on features only present on the BlackBerry 10 platform

BB10-WebWorks-Framework.desc: Framework that is packaged by the BB10-WebWorks-Packager with an Application to run on the BlackBerry 10
BB10-WebWorks-Framework.branchinfo: 'master' is current release, 'next' is the next, unreleased, version

BB10-WebWorks-Packager.desc: The Packager bundles the App content with the Framework from BB10-WebWorks-Packager to create a BAR to run on the BlackBerry 10
BB10-WebWorks-Packager.branchinfo: 'master' is current release, 'next' is the next, unreleased, version - 'next-bb' I don't know
BB10-WebWorks-Packager.note: Unclear what is the difference between 'next-bb' and 'next'

bbUI.js.desc: Toolkit to build WebWorks Applications providing the BlackBerry UI and Design Language
bbUI.js.branchinfo: Both branches are for all platforms; 'master' is the current version and 'next' is the next version

Boost.branchinfo: '1_48_0-dinkum' is version for Dinkum libraries; '1_48_0-gnu' uses the GCC libraries

BWS-Samples.desc: Samples showing how to use the BlackBerry Web Services for Enterprise Administration in Java and C#

Cascades-Community-Samples.desc: Cascades and native Sample Applications, from RIM and others
Cascades-Community-Samples.note: Name of repository may change to reflect it includes non-Cascades native samples.  Samples are supported across releases in a best-effort manner
Cascades-Community-Samples.branchinfo: Ignore the 'Macadamian' branch; it needs to be deleted

Cascades-Samples.desc: Cascades Sample Applications, supported by RIM
Cascades-Samples.note: Unlike Cascades-Community-Samples, RIM is committed to supporting these samples across releases

Community.branchinfo: The 'gh-pages' branch is the important one and the default branch; 'master' is vestigial

Community-APIs-for-AIR.desc: Extension APIs for Adobe AIR using ANE (AIR Native Extension) API

Gameplay.branchinfo: 'master' is current development, 'next' is next release, and 'gh-pages' is documentation

NDK-Samples.branchinfo: 'master' is PlayBook 2, 'ndk1' is PlayBook 1, 'next' is BlackBerry 10, and 'develop' is next (beta) Release in BlackBerry 10
NDK-Samples.note: Arguably these samples should be elsewhere, but there is a (temporary?) technical reason to keep them in this separate repository

QtCascades-Samples.desc: Port of Samples from Qt documentation to use Cascades

Ripple-UI.branchinfo: 'master' is current development, 'next' is next release

Samples-for-AIR.branchinfo: Master branch is for PlayBook; bb10 branch is for BlackBerry 10

Samples-for-Java.desc: Samples for the Java-Based BlackBerry OS Smarphones

Scoreloop-Samples.branchinfo:
'master' is PlayBook; 'BB10.0.06' is latest BlackBerry 10
Name is arguably inconsistent with other conventions
Scoreloop-Samples.note: We need to decide where WebWorks integration will go

WebGL-Samples.branchinfo: 'master' is current development for all platforms; 'gh-pages' is mostly for staging the demo
WebGL-Samples.note: Samples should work on PlayBook and on BB10 devices. WebGL is delivered wrapped as a WebWorks Application

WebWorks-API-Docs.desc: Development Repo for the Documentation for WebWorks
WebWorks-API-Docs.branchinfo: 'master' is current development for BB10; 'next-BB10' is development for next beta release of BB10; 'Smartphone' and 'tablet' are for BBOS Smartphones and BlackBerry PlayBook

WebWorks-Community-APIs.branchinfo: 'master' is current development for all platforms; the other two should be deleted (need to triple check)
WebWorks-Community-APIs.note: Extensions vary depending on platform.  Still discussing whether to place the BB10 implementation in this repo

WebWorks-Samples.desc: WebWorks Sample Applications, from RIM and others
WebWorks-Samples.branchinfo: 'master' is current development for all platforms; 'gh-pages' is mostly for staging the demo
